methods.javadoc:
Gets the Eclipse Integration options.
@return The Eclipse Integration options.
methods.name: getEclipseIntegrationOptions
getEclipseExecutableFile

throws.comment: if the executable file does not exist.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the Eclipse workspace directory.  If it is defined, the directory may or may not exist.
 If it is undefined, Eclipse will be in control of selecting a workspace directory to use.
@return The Eclipse workspace directory. The directory may or may not exist.  Could return
   null if the workspace directory is undefined.
methods.name: getEclipseWorkspaceDir
methods.comment:
Gets the Eclipse workspace directory.  If it is defined, the directory may or may not exist.
 If it is undefined, Eclipse will be in control of selecting a workspace directory to use.

return.comment:
The Eclipse workspace directory. The directory may or may not exist.  Could return
   null if the workspace directory is undefined.

methods.name: isEclipseFeatureInstalled
methods.comment: Checks to see if a feature is installed in Eclipse.

params.name: filter
params.comment: A filename filter that matches the feature file to check.

return.comment: True if the specified feature is installed.

methods.name: connectToEclipse
methods.comment:
Attempts to connect to Eclipse on the given port.  This may result in Eclipse
 being launched.  If the launch and/or connection fails, an error message will
 be displayed.

return.comment:
The (possibly failed) connection.  Check the status of the EclipseConnection
   for details on the connection.

methods.javadoc:
Offers to install GhidraDev into Eclipse's dropins directory.
@param monitor The task monitor used to cancel the installation.
methods.name: offerGhidraDevInstallation
methods.comment: Offers to install GhidraDev into Eclipse's dropins directory.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: The task monitor used to cancel the installation.

methods.name: handleEclipseError
methods.comment: Displays the given Eclipse related error message in an error dialog.

params.name: error
params.comment: The error message to display in a dialog.

params.name: askAboutOptions
params.comment:
True if we should ask the user if they want to be taken to the Eclipse
   options; otherwise, false.

params.name: t
params.comment: An optional throwable to tie to the message.
